intro: Scrophularia trifoliata, commonly known as three-leaved figwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, trifoliate leaves that are hairy and lance-shaped. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks. Scrophularia trifoliata is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
